New Records: Korea secured their sixth consecutive match with zero goals conceded
Key Match Events: Son Heung-min scored a brace for a fifth straight win under manager Jurgen Klinsmann
Jung Seung-hyun scored his first-ever goal for the national team
Korea thrashed China 3-0 in a second round match of the Asian qualifiers for the 2026 World Cup
Pre-Game Insights: Klinsmann did not make significant changes to the starting XI from the match against Singapore on Thursday last week
Regular captain Son stood up and converted the penalty
Post-Match Reflections: The team’s attack no longer seems to be an issue, unlike Klinsmann’s first five games in charge when Korea only managed four goals due to a lack of goal decisiveness
Regular striker picks Cho Gue-sung and Hwang Ui-jo did not get on the scoresheet during Tuesday’s game, but their improvements in the recent fixtures are a bright sign for Klinsmann
Miscellaneous Highlights: Korea have four more matches in the second round of the Asian qualifiers left to play
The stage takes them through June next year, with the next qualifier scheduled on March 21 against Thailand at home
Before Korea play the qualifier on March 21, they will head to Qatar in January for the AFC Asian Cup
Others: The Korean national team celebrated Son Heung-min's goal during a World Cup qualifier against China at Shenzhen Universiade Sports Centre in Shenzhen, China on Tuesday
Korea have allowed their opponents no marks on the scoresheet while scoring 19 since the friendly with Wales on Sept. 8
